_header: The Cook of London while the Reve spake
_description: Geoffrey Chaucer, the Cook’s Prologue of the Canterbury Tales — 40 lines in couplets.

BodArcSelB14.First Lines:
The cook of londoun while the Reve spakfor ioye him thoughte he
                    clawede him on the bak…
BodArcSelB14.Last Lines:
…and therwithal he loughe & made chereand seide his tale
                    as ye shal affter here
BodArcSelB14.Attributed Title:
…And next / folwith the prolog of the Cook of londoun (f. 64); Cokes
                    prolog (RT); Here endith the Cook his prolog (f. 64v)

BodBar20.First Lines:
The coke of london while þe Reue spakeffor Ioy hym þought
                    he clowed hym on þe bake…
BodBar20.Last Lines:
…And ther with al he lough and made chereAnd said his tale as
                    ȝe shul after here
BodBar20.Attributed Title:
…and here / by gynnyth þe prolog of þe Cookes tale (f.
                        51v, rubric); The Coke (RT); Here endith þe Prolog of
                    þe Cokes tale (f. 52, rubric)

Bod686.First Lines:
The Coke of london while þe Reve spakeffor Ioy him þought
                    he claued him on his bake…
Bod686.Last Lines:
…And ther with al he lough and made cheereAnd seyd his tale as
                    ye shal after heere
Bod686.Attributed Title:
…And / here begynneth the prolage of þe Cookes tale (rubric, f.
                    54); Cooke (rubric, RT)

BodHatDon1.First Lines:
The Coke of londoun whiles þe ryve spakffor Ioly he
                    þoȝt to haue claued him in þe bake…
BodHatDon1.Last Lines:
…And þere with all þey lough and made chereAnd seid
                    his tale as ye shall aftre here

BodLauMis600.First Lines:
The cook of London whil þe Reue spakffor Ioie him þought
                    he clowed him on þe bak…
BodLauMis600.Last Lines:
…And þerwiþal he lough and made chereAnd saide his
                    tale as ye shal aftir here
BodLauMis600.Attributed Title:
HEre begynneth the prolog of þe Cokes tale (f. 61); the prolog of
                    þe coke (RT)

BodLauMis739.First Lines:
[T]He cok of londoun while the Refe spakeffor ioy hym yoght he
                    clawed hym on the bake…
BodLauMis739.Last Lines:
…And therwith loughe and made gode chereAnd seyd his tale as
                    ȝe shall here

BodRawPoe141.First Lines:
The Cook of London while the reue spakffor Ioye he thought he
                    clawed on his bak…
BodRawPoe141.Last Lines:
…And there with al he lough & made chereAnd seyde his tale
                    ye shull here
BodRawPoe141.Note:
I.4355 omitted; spurious line follows 4356; 4339-40
                    reversed.
BodRawPoe141.Attributed Title:
…Here bygynneth the prolog of the Cookes tale (f. 27v);
                    The Cook (RT)

OxfChrCh152.First Lines:
THe Cook of london while the Reve spakeffor Ioy hym
                    thought he clawed hym on the bak…
OxfChrCh152.Last Lines:
…And ther with alle loughe and made good chereAnd seide his
                    tale as ye shulle after here
OxfChrCh152.Attributed Title: Here be gynneth the prologe of the coke of londoun (f. 57)

OxfCCC198.First Lines:
THe Cook of london whil þe Reue spakffor ioye he þoughte
                    he clawed him on þe bak…
OxfCCC198.Last Lines:
…And þer wiþ al he lough and made cheereAnd saide
                    his tale as ȝe schal after heere

OxfTri49.First Lines:
The Coke of London whil the Reue spakefor ioy hym thought he clawid
                    hym on his bakke…
OxfTri49.Last Lines:
…and ther with all he lough and made chereand seide his
                    prologe in this manere

CULDd424.First Lines:
THe Cok of London while the Reve spakffor ioye him þoughte he
                    clawed him on the bak…
CULDd424.Last Lines:
…And ther with alle he lough & made chereAnd seide his
                    tale as ȝe shuln after here

CULGg427.First Lines:
THe cook of lundene whil ȝe reue spakffor ioye hym
                    thouȝte he clawede hym on þe bak…
CULGg427.Last Lines:
…And þerwithal he low & made chereAnd seyde hese tale
                    as ȝe schal aftyr here
CULGg427.Note:
The illustration of the Cook follows Cook’s Prologue at the
                    foot of f. 192v, but the following leaf and all of the Tale
                    are lost.

BLHar1758.First Lines:
THe Cook of london while the Reue spakffor ioye hym thought he
                    clowid hym on þe bak…
BLHar1758.Last Lines:
…Our oost answerde & seide I graunte it theNow telle on
                    Roger loke that it be good…
BLHar1758.Note:
I.4346-64 lost; 4339-40 reversed. A blank space of about about ten lines
                    intervenes between the explicit for the Miller’s Tale and
                    the incipit for the Cook’s Prologue.
BLHar1758.Attributed Title:
Here begynneth the Prolog of the Cokes tale (f. 45v); The Cokes
                    Tale (RT)

BLHar7333.First Lines:
ÞE cooke of london whiles þe Reve spakeffor Ioye he
                    thought he clowed him on þe backe…
BLHar7333.Last Lines:
…Þaughe þat my tale beo of an hostelierNe beo not
                    wroþe and tolde as ye may here…

BLHar7334.First Lines:
He Cook of london whil þe Reeue spakffor ioye he þought
                    he clawed him on þe bak…
BLHar7334.Last Lines:
…And þer with al he lowh and made chereAnd seyde his tale
                    as ȝe schal after heere
